comments:
src/org/eclipse/jst/ws/internal/common/J2EEUtils.java throws a Null excpetion 
if the selection (or project) doesn't have a component defined. This happens 
due to statements like -
    if ( comp.getComponentTypeId().equals(IModuleConstants.JST_WEB_MODULE)){
in all the is* methods in J2EEUtils. Atleast two places check for project != 
null before calling any of these is* methods but this check is not done for 
component. This is creating problems for us while using a non-J2EE Web Project 
with WTP Web Services Wizard.

Created an attachment (id=24339)
Patch to J2EEUtils to stop it from throwing null pointer exceptions

I've attached a very simple patch for this. If this patch seems reasonable then
please include this into WTP source.

Hi Chuck,
   Neeraj has created a patch for J2EEUtils that you might want to add.

   Thanks.
The code this patch was made for was redesigned and with better null checks, so this problem should no longer occur. Please reopen with a fresh stack trace if it does. Thanks - CB.
Resolved 6 months ago as fixed. Verified as such on behalf of submitter. Please resubmit if the problem recurs on WTP 1.5.1 or higher.
